content.description:
The route starts to the right of where one can look up towards the tree at the top of the first pitch (~30m), and traverses across onto the main face mid way up the pitch. Protection is okay until after the traverse, where it becomes quite run-out to the top of the first pitch. There is a solid crack just past the tree at the top of the first pitch on a good belay ledge that can be used to set up an anchor. The second pitch is quite short (~10m), and lets you access the huge tree (which is rooted in multiple places over a large area and has a large trunk) that you can rappel off of (you'll need two ropes for the rappel, it's approximately 40m). There is the potential to scramble off the top of the route from here.

First ascent was on a double rack
The main wall is largely unexplored at this time (if someone else knows more, please update), but has a potential for other routes. The granite is fairly solid in places but can be chossy in others.
